intro: Ruschia frederici, commonly known as the Cape tulip, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family and is characterized by its vibrant, showy flowers that range from yellow to orange. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils and thrives in full sun. Its leaves are succulent and fleshy, adapted to store water in arid environments. Ruschia frederici is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and rockeries.
